Package be.geertvanderpijpen.thinkinginjava.exercises.chapter01

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AllTheColorsOfTheRainbow
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Shows the nomenclature of classes (camel case)
    and class members (camel case with first letter lower case
    ATypeName
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    ATypeName is a dummy class with no content to demonstrate the use of new classes in Java
    Autoboxing
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates autoboxing:
    Primitive data types are automatically converted to wrapper class types when needed
    The same applies in the other way around
    The main program creates a value for every primitve type and prints the value.
    DataOnly
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Holds 3 members of different types: i (int) d (double) b (boolean) The members are default initialized, so there is no explicit initialization
    DemonstrateATypeName
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    This class demonstrates the use of the dummy class ATypeName
    A new instance of ATypeName is created in the main program
    In order to make things more interesting, the static instance of ATypeName is printed to standard out
    DemonstrateDataOnly
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates the use of the DataOnly class
    First, the default values of the DataOnly members are printed to standard out
    Then, values are assigned to the DataOnly instance object: i : 47 d : 1.1 b : false At last, the values of the member fieds are printed again to show the difference
    DemonstrateIncrementable
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Main program that demonstrates how Incrementable.increment() is able to increment StaticTest.i
    First, the initial value of StaticTest.i is printed
    Then the Incrementable.increment() method is called a couple of times
    With in between a print of the value.
    DemonstrateTIJStringUtilsStorage
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates the TIJStringUtils class storage function (see TIJStringUtils.storage(String))
    A String object is passed to TIJStringUtils.storage(String) method.
    HelloDate
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Displays a String and today's date
    Javadoc even accepts HTML lists:
    Item 1 Item 2
    HelloWorld
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    This class prints a "Hello World" statement to standard out
    Incrementable
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    This class has the ability to increment StaticTest.i
    Initialization
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    This class showcases default initialization in Java
    An unitialized integer and char variable are printed
    to show the default values Java assigns
    Since only class members are initialized, the two variables are
    static class members.
    Overloading
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates the concept of method overloading using the Tree class.
    PrintCommandLineArguments
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    The main program takes the first 3 parameters from the command line and prints them
    If there are less than 3 parameters, it prints all the parameters, if any
    StaticTest
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    This class is a dummy class to include a static integer field.
    Tree
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    A tree that has as sole member field its height
    Trees can be planted as seedlings (0 height)
    Or created with an initial height
